person.persName: John D. Belden (Marion County, Kentucky, merchant, justice of the peace, captain and second lieutenant (U.S.A.))

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, merchant, justice of the peace and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Beldon and Nancy Beldon. Married to Melissa Jane Edwards Beldon in Casey County, Kentucky, on April 2, 1851. Father of Nina Beldon, Emily Beldon, John Beldon, James Beldon, and Anna Beldon. Merchant in Casey County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Casey County in 1850. Merchant in Marion County in 1860. Employed Samuel Belden as a Clerk in Marion County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Marion County in 1862. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a second lieutenant and captain from September 8, 1862 to September 17, 1863.
